definition: to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society

sentences.english: Time makes common, couples are more like the partners corperating to live together with few conversations.
sentences.chinese: 夫妻之间越来越像搭帮过日子的伙伴，话越来越少了。

definition: to join up with sb/to become partner/to take meals regularly in cafeteria
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)
branch secretary/secretary of a branch of the Communist Party or the Communist Youth League/abbr. for 支部書記|支部书记
to be of one mind/to think or act alike
fellow townsman/fellow villager/sb from the same hometown

(category defined by the Communist Party) poor and lower-middle peasants: farmers who, before land reform, possessed little or no land (poor peasants) and those who were barely able to support themselves with their own land (lower-middle peasants)
a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
